definition: strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Who is this king, but a king of air?
sentences.chinese: 哪一个君王不过是外强中干的空架子？

sentences.english: But I am "outwardly strong and inwardly weak".
sentences.chinese: 可是我觉得我现在是“外强中干”。

sentences.english: Is Iran really dangerous, or is it just a paper tiger?
sentences.chinese: 伊朗真的会造成威胁，抑或只是外强中干？

definition: lit. show strength while weak inside (idiom); appearing fierce while cowardly at heart/a sheep in wolf's clothing
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
to give no cause for anxiety/nothing to worry about
a centipede dies but never falls down/old institutions die hard
pinyin: bai3 zu2 zhi1 chong2 si3 er2 bu4 jiang1

definition: lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
